required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Collection of RNA Extracted From Nasopharyngeal and Saliva Samples From Same Patients With Suspicion of Covid-19
clinical_study.official_title: Collection of SARS-CoV-2 RNA Extracted From Nasopharyngeal and Saliva Samples From Same Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Constitution of a collection of SARS-CoV-2 RNA extracts from nasopharyngeal and saliva / sputum samples, from the same patients (paired samples), taken during the same consultation in an indication of detection of SARS-CoV-2 in with a view to developing tests / diagnostic tools for SARS-CoV-2.

detailed_description.textblock:
In order to preserve their anonymity, the participant will be identified in a dedicated form by a unique identification number. An identification list of participants will be kept in the investigator's file. The investigator will ensure that the anonymity of each person participating in the research is guaranteed.
The source documents are the original documents, data and files from which the data concerning the participant is reported in the Data set_COLL001.xls form provided to the investigator which will serve as an observation notebook.
The investigator must agree to allow direct access to research source data during monitoring, audit or inspection visits. The source data is for the most part computerized and accessible after authorization.
The data will be transcribed into an Excel form Data set_COLL001.xls pseudonymized form which will serve as an observation book. The data will be recorded and then transmitted to ID SOLUTIONS via the Data set_COLL001.xls form provided to the investigator.

primary_outcome.measure: collection of RNA extracted nasopharyngeal and saliva samples
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 month over which the samples of each participant are collected then tested
primary_outcome.description: The expected outcome is The study will allow a collection of n=130 positive n=130 negative RNA extracted from both nasopharyngeal and saliva samples from patients with suspicious COVID-19 will enter the collection No immediate outcome is expected for patients enrolled in the study

arm_group.arm_group_label: RNA extracted from Positive NSP samples
arm_group.description: RNA extracted from NSP samples, found positive for the presence of SARS-CoV-2

arm_group.arm_group_label: RNA extracted from Positive saliva samples
arm_group.description: RNA extracted from saliva samples found positive for the presence of SARS-CoV-2

arm_group.arm_group_label: RNA extracted from negative NSP samples
arm_group.description: RNA extracted from NSP samples, found negative for the presence of SARS-CoV-2

arm_group.arm_group_label: RNA extracted from negative saliva samples
arm_group.description: RNA extracted from saliva samples found negative for the presence of SARS-CoV-2

intervention.description: when the patient goes to the laboratory for a covid 19 diagnostic from a routine nasopharingeal sample, an additionnal sample of saliva is asked
intervention.arm_group_label: RNA extracted from Positive saliva samples
RNA extracted from negative saliva samples

biospec_descr.textblock: RNA extracted from nasopharyngeal and saliva / sputum extracts from the same patients

study_pop.textblock: Patients with an indication for SARS-CoV-2 screening

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male, female adult
- Patient with an indication for SARS-CoV-2 screening.
- Patient having been informed and having given his non-objection to participate in the study
- Patient affiliated with a French social security scheme or beneficiary of such a scheme
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or breastfeeding women
- Vulnerable people Adults placed under tutorship or curatorship or under judicial protection, Patient unable to personally give consent, or adult protected by law, Opposition expressed to inclusion in the study.

patient_data.ipd_description: the data will not be shared to other researchers since the research is an internal collection of samples; for ID SOLUTIONS
